availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Pennsylvania soldier. Bucks County, Pennsylvania, native. Son of Samuel Smith and Anne Lacey Wilkinson Smith. Married to Ann Mason Simpson on October 17, 1844. Father of Robert S. Smith and William B. Smith. Graduated from the United States Military Academy in 1838. Served in the First United States Dragoons as a second lieutenant, first lieutenant, captain, and major from July 1, 1838 to August 3, 1861. Served in the 2nd California Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) as colonel from October 2, 1861 to November 3, 1861. Promoted to Brigadier General of Volunteers on March 17, 1862. Promoted to Major General of Volunteers on May 12, 1864. Commanded the XVI Corps of the Union Army.

ab.bibl:
